derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English grīpan 'grasp, clutch', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch grijpen, German greifen 'seize', also to grip and grope. Sense 2 dates from the 17th cent.; sense 1, of US origin, dates from the 1930s

entry.def: If you say that someone is griping, you mean they are annoying you because they keep on complaining about something.

example.ex: Why are football players griping when the average salary is half a million dollars?...
example.tran: 足球运动员的平均薪水已达50万美金，他们为什么还要抱怨呢？

example.ex: They were always griping about high prices.
example.tran: 他们总是抱怨物价太高。

entry.def: A gripe is a complaint about something.

example.ex: My only gripe is that one main course and one dessert were unavailable.
example.tran: 我唯一不满的就是连一道主菜和一份甜点都没有。

sentences.en: Bring all your gripes to the boss.
